column1:
fix(config): Apply config change from Atom, process locking

Summary:
https://github.com/atom/atom/commit/d1c44dcb54994eb733eff0bfde69c8454aeff22c

Also lock config across processes to prevent the user from being logged out when the main process reads config before it's finished writing. This is what is causing the login window to appear.

Test Plan: Rapidly tap between the two display modes. Note that it no longer reverts to the wrong one intermittently.

Reviewers: evan

Reviewed By: evan

Differential Revision: https://phab.nylas.com/D1931
column3: the main process reads config before it's finished writing.

column1:
Masonry: MasonryInfinite for infinite fetching (#307)

* Masonry: MasonryInfinite for infinite fetching

- Pulled fetching out from Masonry
- MasornyInfinite is exported as the old Masonry
 and should function the same
- export MasonryBeta as it can be used with custom
 fetching logic
- This provides a graceful migration path.
- Final migration will involve renaming
 MasonryBeta/MasonryInfinite/Masrony
- Existing Masonry integration will be testing MasonryInfinite to ensure
 compatibility

* Addressed comments

* Refactored layout calculations into states

* Immutable items check for isfetching

* Update onmount code and tests

- removed unused code
- scrollFetchOnload test is updated to match
 existing values on master (TEST_FETCH_COUNTS === 1 when
 manualFetch = 1)
- added timeout to fix flaky tets
- added missing await

* Addressed comments

- renamed to onVirtualizationWindowUpdate
- moved to helper function: layoutClass and statesForRendering

* Changed to use onAutoMeasuring callback

* Used ref callback

[CORL-645] Add Slack support for v5 (#2713)

* Create preliminary schema for setting Slack channels

CORL-645

* Implement preliminary slack notification using tenant slack channels

CORL-645

* Very preliminarily get data loading with FieldArray's for slack channels

CORL-645

* Update settings input on schema to allow saving Slack settings to tenant

CORL-645

* Filter off UNMODERATED queue events from slack channels

We don't send these to slack through our filters, we only care
about pending, reported, and featured

CORL-645

* Include a moderation link in comments pushed to Slack

CORL-645

* Hook up proper callback functions for adding/removing slack channels

CORL-645

* Add missing translation for Slack navigation item

CORL-645

* Update snapshots for preliminary Slack configuration changes

CORL-645

* Add some FormField wrappers around slack config elements

Makes the UI appear a little nicer

CORL-645

* Set up slack config to only provide one slack channel

We need to do this until we can get ArrayField's working
in final-form.

CORL-645

* Disable the other trigger checkboxes when "All Comments"" is checked

CORL-645

* Clean up the formatting of Slack messages

CORL-645

* Add error handling around sending comments to Slack

CORL-645

* Add links to external Slack setup documentation

CORL-645

* Replace form state with wrapped field element

CORL-645

* Clean up fetch request sending Slack notifications

CORL-645

* Prefer global string replacement over RegEx

CORL-645

* Use URL class to construct comment URL's

CORL-645

* Require slack configuration in schema

CORL-645

* Initialize Slack in fixtures

Also fix up a flaky test that wasn't waiting
on form submission and on-change events.

CORL-645

* Preliminarily fix up styles to match other config pages

CORL-645

* Create placeholder add/remove buttons

* Convert SlackConfigContainer to FunctionalComponent

CORL-645

* Add name field to slack channels

CORL-645

* Disable inner fields on Slack channel when not enabled

CORL-645

* Improve the delete channel button

CORL-645

* Use pureMerge to extract slack channel settings

CORL-645

* Do a bit of cleanup on the add channel button

CORL-645"

Visual Viewport API web platform tests flaky on desktop

On Android, sometime we can't get the first frame, which would cause intermittent fail. See bug1546128;On Windows, sometime we would get incorrect text color rendering, which would also cause intermittent fail. See bug1546133.

Anchor clicks are only handled if we have a pres-context, and we may not have one yet by the time this runs, and getBoundingClientRect() won't construct it after bug 1440537. So we may need to wait a few frames to make this reliable.
Badge test taking longer for the UI condition to be met
column8: added waiting time and instead of throwing error added a check to fail the test

column3: Previously we would wait for one async frame and some more time to ensure we have received the local times on main thread. This can be flaky.
column8: Instead wait until local time is no longer null which means worklet has produced at least one frame and that frame has been synced with main.

column3: Previously we would wait for one async frame and some more time to ensure we have received the local times on main thread. This can be flaky.

Fix/datepicker onchange (#1631)

* test(DatePicker): remove `beforeEach`

and be explicit about onChange spy

* test(DatePicker): move some test cases under describes

just to organize tests better

* test(DatePicker): refactor `placeholder` tests

* test(DatePicker): refactor readonly & locale tests

* fix(DatePicker): mingle only with date and not time

by default react-daypicker resets the time of given value
this is undesirable and unexpected. this commit fixes so that only year,
month and day could be adjusted by datepicker leaving time part alone

* test(DatePicker): use explicit timezone in test

otherwise different environment will interpret it differently and thus
test becomes flaky

column1: Use EditText's background for the filled text field and fix underline flakiness
column3: underline used to not meet the edges until drawableStateChanged() was called after a layout pass.
column8: Changed from From set the {@link EditText}'s background to an outlined box -> set the {@link EditText}'s background to an outlined or filled box. TextInputLayout was attempting to use EditText's pre-existing underline, and the bounds of that Drawable weren't known in order to modify them until after drawableStateChanged()

column1: clickOnButton(String) working differently Debug vs Run in Android Studio

column3: Concurrency
column5: invoke RestMockServer.reset() after a test, at the same time the method getMatchedRequests() is iterating the matchableCalls list because some background thread made a request after the test already ended.
column7: Run Tests Outside of Test Suite Contextreset
column8: using IdlingResources to make Espresso wait for our background tasks, replacing the matchableCalls type from LinkedList to CopyOnWriteArrayList.

column1: Consecutive app launches fail at times
column3: Launching an app dynamically is performed by moving to the recent-apps view on the device, and then selecting the app by using UIAutomator. Instead of showing the app name, the recent-apps view shows the full activity name instead. UIAutomator can't cope with that.
column5: Launch app may fail when the app is already running in the foreground https://github.com/wix/Detox/blob/c982798e8904b8384e4966f4ed20700b66921b39/detox/test/e2e/20.background-foreground.transitions.test.js
column7: Run Tests Outside of Test Suite Contextreset
column8: Change the way handles app-launching invoked at runtime(do not use UIAutomator)

column8: (Suggestion) have the option to run a script after the emulator has booted to allow custom configuration

column3: The test was flaky due to openActionBarOverflowOrOptionsMenu(). That method works well API level 28 and below but is very flaky after 29.
column8: added Activity#openOptionsMenu() call which opens menu if it is not displayed yet otherwise no-op. Unfortunately, we still need to keep both calls because openOptionsMenu() has the same flakiness on API level 28 an below. The long-term solution should be in Espresso.
